title: Why do people always get surprised that I am going to report them for saying "gg ez"
body: Do people think that they are being good human beings for writing that trash in the end of each game or what?

replies.body: They do it so much that it becomes a habit and they don’t think it is a problem, it’s the same thing with flaming, leaving games and other toxic behavior.
well one of the big reasons people are surprised by it is that you cant get banned for saying ggez so it doesnt matter if u report them or not

>you cant get banned for saying ggez

true(ish)

> so it doesnt matter if u report them or not

wrong

You can't be banned for it alone, the system still recognizes it as (very) mildly toxic. So it may actually end up being the straw that broke the camel's back if you previously exhibited other negative behaviour.
saying ggez cant get u banned, regardless of how many bans you've had previously . saying ggez is not bannable offence in any respect, at most it is bm which riot does allow.

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/EnunvHEJ-so-riottantram-riots-thoughts-on-saying-ez-after-a-win?comment=0002

>Yes, it's reportable. Yes, it's negative. Yes, it's unsportsmanlike. Yes, it could help contribute to a penalty.
>No, a single ggez by itself, without further history of unsportsmanlike behavior is not going to result in a penalty.
>If someone does it consistently, that's one thing.
>But don't expect to get a feedback message saying a player has been penalized for each and every time a person says ggez.

Unless you can supply me with a newer quote that directly contradicts this, I'll stick with this.

Edit: On the topic of bm: As far as I'm concerned the acceptable kind of trash talk happens **during** the game, not after. If you have already won and continue making douchey remarks you're just being an asshole. And the summoner's code reflects this, requesting people to show "Humility in Victory, and Grace in Defeat". So I feel confident that Riot's stance on this matter doesn't differ much from my own.
riot doesnt care about the summoners code lol they only use it when it benefits them lol, but nothing i said really contradicts tantram but w/e.

>riot doesnt care about the summoners code lol they only use it when it benefits them lol

What the hell is that even supposed to mean?

>nothing i said really contradicts tantram but w/e.

You specifically said it falls under a category of behaviour that is allowed.
You specifically said it didn't matter whether you reported for it.
You specifically said it wasn't bannable "in any respect".

Do you really think that those don't contradict the statement that it can help contribute to a penalty?

tantram said u couldnt get banned for  saying ggez,  just that it contributes, if it doesnt get u banned it is allowed therefor it doesnt matter if u report it what are u failing to understand.

He said it is reportable but then again anything is reportable, doesnt mean it is bannable. He doesnt explain anything about those who say it consistently so that is unclear but if u say it once u cant get banned. i litterally cant get u banned unless you follow it up with actually toxic comments in which case those comments would be the reason for your ban and not the ggez itself. So ya i stand by what i wrote.
What do you think "contribute to a penalty" means?

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752884-Reporting-a-Player):

> Do not threaten or repeatedly tell a player you will report them. Doing so can encourage players who are already negative to continue their behavior. Whether they know they are being reported or not has no bearing to whether the system will act on them. But most importantly, repeatedly threatening or arguing with a negative player can end up derailing the game for everyone else and then open yourself up to reports and possible disciplinary action as well. Avoid negative thoughts and useless chatting with poor performing teammates! Focus on victory by muting the offending player and then reporting them at the end of the game.
> 
> Do not ask other players in the match to report the offending player. It only takes one report for our systems to review a game. Additional reports will not do anything for the offending player; however as mentioned above, it could open yourself up to a report of your own; especially if you are derailing the match by constantly demanding reports of other players.

Because it's a meme. The winning team says it, the losing team says it, people say it in the middle of the game, my mom says it, probably my dead grandma too. Just laugh it off.
